item.title: Need help with this code
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

import package.className;

You import files above the class definition.

List and ListArray are found in the java.util package.

item.title: Need help with this code
item.dc:creator: @Full_Metalst Full Metalst
item.description:
@Full_Metalst wrote:

I’ll add that in my client.java for a second, and I’ll show you guys the codes.

Here’s the errors, there’s only 2:

client.java:30293: cannot find symbol symbol : class Liest location: class client Liest<String> contents = new ArrayList<String>(); ^ client.java:30293: cannot find symbol symbol : class ArrayList location: class client Liest<String> contents = new ArrayList<String>(); ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I think it’s the ‘Liest’. Are you trying to make it ‘List’? That could be the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with this code
item.dc:creator: @Thrasher_Alpha Thrasher Alpha
item.description:
@Thrasher_Alpha wrote:

I need help with this code. Whats wrong with it? It gives me errors when I compile. Its a code for deltascape that lets you unban and stuff… Im using a deltascape source, just for info.

public void deleteFromFile(String file, String name) throws IOException { BufferedReader r = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file)); Liest<String> contents = new ArrayList<String>(); while(true) { String line = r.readLine(); if(line == null) { break; } else { line = line.trim(); } if(!line.equalsIgnoreCase(name)) { contents.add(line); } } r.close(); BufferedWriter w = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(file)); for(String line : contents) { w.write(line, 0, line.length()); w.newLine(); } w.flush(); w.close(); }

Read full topic
